name: Dust of Appearance
description: One may hide visage, but never volume.

abilities.name: Reveal
abilities.description: Creates an area centered around the wielder that reveals invisible units. Deals damage and applies a movement speed slow to revealed invisible units.
notes: Interrupts the wielder's channeling abilities upon cast
Creates an aura that applies all ability effects on all enemy units within the radius, including visible ones
Reapplying the debuff refreshes the duration
Applies the debuff but does not reveal Shadow Dance-based abilities or Smoke of Deceit-based items
Affects fogged units and invulnerable units
Does not affect hidden units or ward-type units
Multiple overlapping Reveal aura radii do not stack
Explicitly applies the movement speed slow on already invisible units
The debuff does not affect the enemy unit during its fade time or fade delay
The debuff applied on affected enemy units lingers after leaving the effect radius

additionalInfo: Creates 12-second aura applying all ability effects centered around the caster
trivia: This item is based on the Dust of Appearance from Warcraft 3
Prior to the July 14, 2017 Patch, Dust of Appearance's active ability, Reveal, did not have an official name. The name was taken from the Dota 2 Wiki and officially implemented into Dota 2

recentChanges.description: CHANGED Reveal ability operations. Now creates a 12-second aura applying all of its ability effects centered around the caster, instead of applying a debuff. Has an 8-second aura linger duration.
Reveal now deals 25 magical damage to invisible enemies upon placing the debuff.
